body.p: Downstream Modbus settings cannot be changed.

Upstream Modbus provides network characteristics on the upstream side of the Monitor.
Address is the address that the upstream Modbus master, such as the Building Management System (BMS), uses to address the Monitor. The downstream device addresses are incremented sequentially from this address. So, if the Monitor has address 20, the next three devices will appear 21, 22, and 23 to the upstream master device. (See ).
Upstream Modbus settings for Baud rate and Parity must match those for the upstream Modbus master.
